strategy_reasoning: Adopting a 'Dev Garden Journal' theme in a cozy pixel art style makes technical updates (payments, webhooks) feel welcoming and gamified rather than corporate. The retro aesthetic taps into developer nostalgia while keeping the vibe soft and organic.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title screen featuring a cute 8-bit bee character holding a small open journal. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic. Text in pixel font says 'DEV GARDEN UPDATE'. Like Stardew Valley meets coding. Emotionally warm, nostalgic but beautiful.
images.description: Title card establishing the 'Dev Garden' theme with our mascot

images.prompt: Pixel art market stall scene in a garden. A tiny wooden stand displaying glowing pollen jars with pixelated '$' signs. Soft mint and peach pastel background. Retro game UI box at the bottom says 'Stripe USD Support Added'. Cozy 8-bit aesthetic, warm lighting, wholesome vibes like A Short Hike.
images.description: Visualizing the Stripe USD update as a friendly garden market

images.prompt: Retro game power-up screen. A large, glowing golden jar of nectar in the center with '2x' floating above it in chunky pixel text. Sparkles and confetti effects. Soft lime green (#ecf874) background with scanlines. High energy but cozy 8-bit style. Text: 'BETA BONUS ACTIVE'.

Tiny 8-bit bee developer character connecting two green pixel vines together like wires. A dialogue box shows 'Webhook Test: PASS'. Cozy workspace background with a small CRT monitor. Soft lighting, pastel palette. Retro gaming vibes, clean and cute.
images.description: Illustrating local webhook testing as tending to garden connections

caption:

alt_text: A carousel of 4 cozy pixel art images. 1. A cute pixel bee holding a journal against a lime green background. 2. A pixel art market stall selling pollen jars for USD. 3. A glowing golden nectar jar with a 2x multiplier sign. 4. A pixel bee connecting vines to represent webhook testing.
